intro: Edraianthus graminifolius, commonly known as the grass-leaved edraianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, yellow flowers. It is often found in sunny, well-drained habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Montiaceae family.
